title: Villa Dria 2016 Villa Club Doré White (Gers)
description: A soft and fruity aperitif style of wine, this offers plenty of acidity at the end. Drink this light, bright wine now.

title: Barão de Vilar 2016 Vinha das Magarida Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: In this toasty, wood-laden wine, spice mingles with red-berry fruits. It has good acidity, soft tannins and a gently crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Enoport 2017 Vinhas Altas Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: A caramel and red-fruit-flavored wine, this offers crisp acidity and a bright touch of acidity. It's all fruit, with a zesty aftertaste.

title: Fontes da Cunha 2016 Quinta do Mondego Rosé (Dão)
description: This soft, fruity wine offers warm red-berry flavors and light acidity. It is balanced, perfumed and easy to drink now.

title: Hawkins Cellars 2015 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Brown stem, wilted flower, cigar ash and barrel spice aromas lead to short, dried-out fruit flavors in this wine.

title: Kramer NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This was fermented and aged in neutral French oak. A 50-50 mix of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, it uses grapes from the 2014 and 2015 vintages, finished with 8 g/L of residual sugar, which is just perceptible. There's a sharp, off-putting scent of kerosene that lingers in the mouth, obscuring the freshness of the fruit flavors.

title: Las Positas 2016 Albariño (Sacramento County)
description: Rather strong in flavor for this grape variety, the wine has a gold color, exaggerated apricot, peach skin and toasted almond flavors, medium body and nervy fruit flavors. A sense of grip comes from acidity and a touch of tannin.

title: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Fiano (Beneventano)
description: This opens with aromas of ripe citrus, powdered sage, vanilla and a whiff of plastic. The muddled aromas carry over to the lean bitter palate along with an almond note.

title: August Briggs 2014 Two Moon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Barbecue smoke and char dominate on the nose of this robust wine, which is somewhat one-dimensional in that element. Meat and black cherry add background notes.

title: Bodegas Manutara 2016 Desafio Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)
description: This dark-colored Pinot Noir is devoid of varietal character, but it functions well as a generic “house style” red. Its berry aromas are rooty. On the palate, it's shapeless and soft, with jammy berry and plum flavors that flatten out on the finish.

title: Casado Morales 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: This simple rosé has lightly floral but generic aromas. It's tight on the palate, with a decent body and dried apricot flavors that finish slightly salty.

title: CK Mondavi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Rather light in body and savory in flavor, this wine has earthy aromas, mild fruit flavors and a brothy component. It's smooth on the palate.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta de Pancas Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Curiously grassy, this wine brings out bell-pepper flavors that can come from cool-climate Cabernet Sauvignon. It makes for a lean wine, filled with tannins for now. It could grow richer as it ages, but certainly not before 2020.

title: Domaine Chiroulet 2017 Le Temps des Fleurs Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Full of red-berry fruits, this is a soft wine. Its acidity is nicely balanced with the lively blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Tannat, giving both crispness and a lightly tannic texture. Drink the wine now.

title: Happy Camper 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This is a light oaky off-dry wine with a soda-pop freshness and flavors like strawberries and cherry candy.

title: Judd's Hill 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This wine is simple and lacking in full flavor, the characteristics leaning into peppery tobacco and caramel oak.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Grand Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is thick, heavy and tannic, with an herbaceous quality of cedar and pencil. Flavors of dark cherry and chocolate highlight the full-bodied concentration.

title: Liparita 2014 V Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This wine includes 16% Merlot and 2% Petite Sirah. Pungent earth overrides a dense syrupy concentration of blackberry mocha. The tannins are tight and green.

title: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Merlot (California)
description: Spicy oaky accents give a little momentum to this mostly light and appealing wine. It has cinnamon, ginger and vanilla flavors blended with cherry notes.

title: Pinupti 9 2016 The White (McLaren Vale)
description: A blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc with a touch of Fiano, this winer is aromatic in tones of candied banana and peach. The creamy, rich palate doesn't quite follow through and feels disjointed from searing acidity.

title: Siegel 2016 Über Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: The weedy berry aromas in this wine come with a heavy coating of clove and oak. It's narrow in build but heavy, with a resiny character. Clove flavor dominates the palate, with a hot, woodspice-inflected finish.

title: Somnium 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is harsh and somewhat thin on the palate, with a wealth of tannin and smoky oak.

title: Tournon by Michel Chapoutier 2017 Mathilda Grenache Rosé (Victoria)
description: There's plenty of ripe cherry and stone fruit on the nose of this rosé. There's rather searing acidity on the palate that's only just balanced by some palate weight.

title: Ventisquero 2016 Grey Glacier Single Block Sauvignon Blanc
description: This wine's vegetal aromas suggest canned peas. It has a plump, creamy palate but lacks pop. Its green pea and bell pepper flavors are slightly bitter; those same flavors linger on the finish. It hails from the northern Atacama Desert and seems a bit underripe.

title: Viña Casablanca 2017 Cefiro Cool Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: This offers lean, spicy citrus aromas. It's won and flat on the palate, with peppery flavors of celery, lettuce and underripe citrus.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This sturdy medium-bodied wine has good structure and a lightly gripping texture to counterbalance plummy flavors that have an earthy, metallic edge.

title: Fenestra 2012 Silvaspoons Vineyards Touriga (Lodi)
description: Very mature, with earthy leathery aromas, this wine offers a broad smooth texture, and flavors like dried fruits and nuts. It has a good backbone of acidity and light tannins. It is enjoyable for its well-aged bouquet and smoothness on the palate.

title: Iron Hub 2016 Estate Bottled Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This rosé goes for richness and a rather heavy mouthfeel and has flavors like peaches and maraschino cherries that are a touch sweet. The texture is soft and the balance is low in acidity.

title: Mitolo 2017 Jester Sangiovese Rosé (McLaren Vale)
description: This wine offers a mild red fruit tone to the nose and palate, yet is marred by a rather stinky, green quality. It has a lean and mostly dry feel, but the whole package comes off as unbalanced.

title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2016 Lima Mayer Rosé (Alentejano)
description: Estate-grown grapes give a smooth, caramel- and strawberry-flavored wine. It is soft and rounded, with a touch of spice and pepper. Drink now.
